glsa.title: MCrypt: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code
glsa.synopsis: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in MCrypt, allowing attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause Denial of Service.

background.p: MCrypt is a replacement of the old unix crypt(1) utility.

description.p: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in MCrypt:

ul.li: A boundary error in MCrypt could cause a stack-based buffer overflow (CVE-2012-4409).
MCrypt contains multiple format string errors (CVE-2012-4426).
MCrypt does not properly handle long file names, which could cause a stack-based buffer overflow (CVE-2012-4527).

impact.p: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted file using MCrypt, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process or a Denial of Service condition.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All MCrypt users should upgrade to the latest version:
